Dixiana_(band):
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Dixiana | image = Dixiana promo photo.png | caption = | image_size = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1986–1993 | label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | associated_acts = | past_members = Randall Griffith
Mark Lister
Phil Lister
Cindy Murphy
Colonel Shuford }} '''Dixiana''' was an American [[country music]] band. Founded in 1986, the band was composed of five members: brothers Mark ([[bass guitar]], vocals) and Phil Lister ([[guitar]], vocals), Randall Griffith ([[keyboard instrument|keyboards]]), Colonel Shuford ([[Drum kit|drums]]), and Cindy Murphy ([[lead vocals]]).{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p30153|pure_url=yes}} |title=Dixiana biography |accessdate=2008-05-02 |last=Loftus |first=Johnny |work=[[Allmusic]]}} Signed to [[Epic Records]] in 1992, they released their self-titled debut album that year.{{cite magazine |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,350326,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091221025458/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,350326,00.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=December 21, 2009 |title=Dixiana review |accessdate=2008-05-02 |magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=1992-06-26}} It produced three singles, two of which charted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now [[Hot Country Songs]]) charts. The album received a C− rating from ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', who described it as "generic country-pop" but highlighted lead vocalist Murphy as a "strong suit". A fourth single, "Now You're Talkin'", was released in 1993. Joseph Stanley of ''[[Cash Box]]'' praised it as a "fresh and fun cut".{{cite journal|last=Stanley|first=Joseph|date=April 17, 1993|title=Reviews|journal=Cash Box|page=20|url=http://www.americanradiohistory.com/Archive-Cash-Box/90s/1993/CB-1993-04-17.pdf}} Mark and Phil Lister have since co-founded a recording studio called Dixiana Music.{{cite web |url=http://www.dixiana.com/Associates.htm |title=Our Associates |accessdate=2008-05-02 |work=Dixiana Music |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080509150249/http://www.dixiana.com/Associates.htm |archive-date=2008-05-09 |url-status=dead }} ==Discography== ===''Dixiana''=== {{Infobox album | name = Dixiana | type = Studio | artist = Dixiana | cover = Dixiana_-_Dixiana_Cover.jpg | alt = | released = {{start date|1992|4|21}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = The Bennett House | genre = Country | length = 30:55 | label = [[Epic Records]] | producer = [[Bob Montgomery (songwriter)|Bob Montgomery]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[AllMusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}} {{Allmusic|class=album|id=mw0000611007 |label=''Dixiana'' Review |first=Staff |last=Rovi |accessdate=3 May 2021 }} }} {{tracklisting | total_length = 30:55 | title1 = I Didn't Think You'd Care | writer1 = {{hlist|[[Byron Gallimore]]|Don Pfrimmer}} | length1 = 3:24 | title2 = A Heart That Can't Be Had | writer2 = {{hlist|[[Steve Seskin]]|[[Allen Shamblin]]}} | length2 = 3:18 | title3 = [[Waitin' for the Deal to Go Down]] | writer3 = {{hlist|Bobby Fischer|[[Charlie Black]]|[[Austin Roberts (singer)|Austin Roberts]]}} | length3 = 3:13 | title4 = Are You Over Her | writer4 = {{hlist|[[Gail Farrell]]}} | length4 = 3:11 | title5 = It Comes and It Goes | writer5 = {{hlist|[[Robert Ellis Orrall]]|Fischer}} | length5 = 3:33 | title6 = That's What I'm Working on Tonight | writer6 = {{hlist|Lonnie Williams|Nancy Williams|Mary W. Francis}} | length6 = 2:35 | title7 = I Know Where Therre's One | writer7 = {{hlist|Kerry Kurt Phillips|Tammy Pierce}} | length7 = 3:23 | title8 = Chain of Heartaches | writer8 = {{hlist|Pfrimmer|George Teren}} | length8 = 3:01 | title9 = If I Can't Have You | writer9 = Stephony Smith | length9 = 2:43 | title10 = A Little in Love | writer10 = {{hlist|Michael Noble|Jeff Pennig|Scott "Cactus" Moser}} | length10 = 2:34 }} ====The Band==== {{columns-list|colwidth=28em| *Cindy Murphy – Vocals, Background Singer *Mark Lister – Bass, Background Singer *Phil Lister – Guitar, Mandolin, Strings, Background Singer *Randall Griffith – Keyboards *Colonel Shufford – Drums }} ====Additional Musicians==== {{columns-list|colwidth=28em| *Ron Oates – Keyboards, Arranger *[[Lonnie Wilson]] – Drums *Bob Wray – Bass *[[Dave Pomeroy]] – Bass *[[Tim Menzies|Tim Mensy]] – Acoustic Guitar *Bill Hullett – Acoustic Guitar *[[Brent Mason]] – Electric Guitar *[[Jonathan Yudkin]] – Mandolin *Tommy Spurlock – Steel Guitar }} ====Production==== {{columns-list|colwidth=28em| *Denny Purcell – Mastering *Gene Eichelberger – Engineer, Mixer *Shawn McLean – Back-up Engineer *Roy Gamble – Back-up Engineer *Jake Nicely – Back-up Engineer *Cathy Moore – Production Assistant *Randee St. Nicholas – Photography *Bill Johnson – Art Direction *Jodi Lynn Miller – Design Assistant }} Track information and credits verified from the album's liner notes.{{Cite AV media notes |title=Dixiana |others=Dixiana |type=liner notes |access-date= |year=1992 |publisher=[[Epic Records]] |id=EK 48620}} {{clear}} ==Charts== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
